fileDesc.extent: Approx. 81 KB of XML-encoded text transcribed from 36 1-bit group-IV TIFF page images.

availability.p: This keyboarded and encoded edition of the work described above is co-owned by the institutions providing financial support to the Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership. This Phase I text is available for reuse, according to the terms of Creative Commons 0 1.0 Universal. The text can be copied, modified, distributed and performed, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.

projectDesc.p: Created by converting TCP files to TEI P5 using tcp2tei.xsl, TEI @ Oxford.

editorialDecl.p: EEBO-TCP is a partnership between the Universities of Michigan and Oxford and the publisher ProQuest to create accurately transcribed and encoded texts based on the image sets published by ProQuest via their Early English Books Online (EEBO) database (http://eebo.chadwyck.com). The general aim of EEBO-TCP is to encode one copy (usually the first edition) of every monographic English-language title published between 1473 and 1700 available in EEBO.

EEBO-TCP aimed to produce large quantities of textual data within the usual project restraints of time and funding, and therefore chose to create diplomatic transcriptions (as opposed to critical editions) with light-touch, mainly structural encoding based on the Text Encoding Initiative (http://www.tei-c.org).

The EEBO-TCP project was divided into two phases. The 25,363 texts created during Phase 1 of the project have been released into the public domain as of 1 January 2015. Anyone can now take and use these texts for their own purposes, but we respectfully request that due credit and attribution is given to their original source.
Users should be aware of the process of creating the TCP texts, and therefore of any assumptions that can be made about the data.

Text selection was based on the New Cambridge Bibliography of English Literature (NCBEL). If an author (or for an anonymous work, the title) appears in NCBEL, then their works are eligible for inclusion. Selection was intended to range over a wide variety of subject areas, to reflect the true nature of the print record of the period. In general, first editions of a works in English were prioritized, although there are a number of works in other languages, notably Latin and Welsh, included and sometimes a second or later edition of a work was chosen if there was a compelling reason to do so.

Image sets were sent to external keying companies for transcription and basic encoding. Quality assurance was then carried out by editorial teams in Oxford and Michigan. 5% (or 5 pages, whichever is the greater) of each text was proofread for accuracy and those which did not meet QA standards were returned to the keyers to be redone. After proofreading, the encoding was enhanced and/or corrected and characters marked as illegible were corrected where possible up to a limit of 100 instances per text. Any remaining illegibles were encoded as <gap>s. Understanding these processes should make clear that, while the overall quality of TCP data is very good, some errors will remain and some readable characters will be marked as illegible. Users should bear in mind that in all likelihood such instances will never have been looked at by a TCP editor.
The texts were encoded and linked to page images in accordance with level 4 of the TEI in Libraries guidelines.

Copies of the texts have been issued variously as SGML (TCP schema; ASCII text with mnemonic sdata character entities); displayable XML (TCP schema; characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or text strings within braces); or lossless XML (TEI P5, characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or TEI g elements).
Keying and markup guidelines are available at the Text Creation Partnership web site.

div.p: A CATALOGUE OF BOOKS PUBLISHED IN AMERICA, AND FOR SALE AT THE BOOKSTORE OF JOHN WEST, No. 75, Cornhill, BOSTON.

row.cell: ADAMS' Flowers of Ancient and Modern Hiſtory, 2 vols.

— Flowers of Modern Travels: being elegant, entertaining, and inſtructive Extracts, from the moſt celebrated Travellers; particularly Lord Lyttleton, Sir W. Hamilton, Baron de Tott, Dr. Johnſon, Dr. Moore, Addiſon, Brydone, Wraxall, Savery, &c. &c. 2 vols.
Adams' (his Excellency John) twenty-ſix Letters upon the Revolution of America, written in Holland, in the year 1780,
Adams' (Hannah) View of the various Religious Denominations which have appeared in the world, from the beginning of the Chriſtian era, to the preſent day, &c.
Alexander's Hiſtory of Women, from the earlieſt antiquity to the preſent time, 2 vols.
Alexander's Virgil, tranſlated into literal Engliſh Proſe, with explanatory Notes,
Alkin's Letters to his Son, on various Topics, relative to Literature, and the conduct of Life.
American Spectator; or, Matrimonial Preceptor; a Collection of Eſſays, Epiſtles, Precepts, and Examples, relating to the Married State,

— Young Man's beſt Companion: containing Spelling, Reading, Writing, Arithmetic, Bookkeeping—Meaſuring —Guaging, Letters on Buſineſs, Friendſhip, &c. Forms of Deeds, Bonds, &c. a very uſeful and valuable book for Young Men,
American Pocket Atlas, containing a map of each State, and of the United States, with a conciſe deſcription of each ſtate,
— Juſtice's Aſſiſtant,
— Theatre, 2 vols.
— Clerk's Magazine, New Edition,
— Remembrancer; or, an Impartial Collection of Eſſays, Reſolves, &c. relative, to the Treaty with Great Britain, 3 vols.
— Farmer's Letters; deſcribing certain Provincial Situations, Manners and Cuſtoms; and conveying ſome idea of the State of the People of North America,
— Preceptor; being a new Selection of Leſſons for Reading and Speaking; deſigned for the Uſe of Schools,
Same book,
— Coaſt Pilot; with directions for Sailing into and out of all the Principal Harbours, with a Tide Table, &c. &c.
— Atlas, containing, Twenty Maps of the different parts of America, and one Chart of the W. Indies,
Ditto, Coloured,
Arabian Nights Entertainments, conſiſting of one Thouſand and one pleaſing and inſtructive Stories, 2 vols.
Antidote to Deiſm, 2 vols.
Afflicted Man's Companion, (by Williſon)
Atlas, for the preſent European War, including every place where the War has been carried on,
Artiſt's Aſſiſtant, in Drawing, Perſpective, Painting, &c.
Art of Speaking,
Addiſon's Evidences of the Chriſtian Religion,
Almoran and Hamet, an Oriental Tale,
Alexis, or the Cottage in the Woods, a Novel,
Art of Courting,
Akenſide's Pleaſures of Imagination, to which is added, Armſtrong's Art of preſerving Health,
Arnold's (I. L. Eſq.) Miſcellaneous Poems,
BURKITT's Expoſition of the New Teſtament, with Practical Obſervations, wherein the whole of the Sacred Text is recited, and the Senſe explained, 4to.
Bunyan's Pilgrim's Progreſs, from this world to that which is to come, with the Life of the Author,
— Holy War, 62½ and
— Law and Grace,
— Viſions for Youth,
Boyle's Voyages and Adventures, in various parts of the World,
Beattie's Elements of Moral Science, 2 vols.
Brydone's Tour through Sicily and Malta,
Baron Trenck, complete, 6ſ and
— Abridged,
Blair's Sermons, 2 vols. 8vo.
— 3 vols. 12mo.
Bennet's Letters to a young Lady, on a variety of uſeful and intereſting Subjects,
— and Strictures,
— Strictures, on Female Education,
Beccaria on Crimes and Puniſhments, with a Commentary by M. de Voltaire,
Booth's Reign of Grace, from its Riſe to its Conſummation,
Burton's Lectures on Female Education and Manners,
Beauties of the Creation,
— of Hiſtory; or Pictures of Virtue and Vice drawn from real Life, 2 vols.
— of Sterne, including all his Pathetic Tales and moſt diſtinguiſhed Obſervations on Life,
— of Hervey,
— of Fielding, carefully ſelected from his Works, with ſome Account of his Life,
Berridge's Chriſtian World Umaſked,
Briſſot on the Commerce of America with Europe, with a Sketch of the Life of Briſſot,
Burn's Abridgment of the American Juſtice,
Belknap's American Biography, 1 75 and
— Hiſtory of New Hampſhire, 3 vols.
— Diſſertations, on the Character, Death, and Reſurrection of Jeſus Chriſt, and the Evidence of his Goſpel,
Blair's Lectures on Rhetoric and the Belles Lettres, 2 vols.
Same work abridged,
Bell on the Venereal Diſeaſe,
Buchan's Domeſtic Medicine; or, Family Phyſician,
Burgh's Dignity of Human Nature, in four Books, 1ſt of Prudence; 2d of Knowledge; 3d of Virtue; 4th of Revealed Religion,
Butler's Analogy of Religion, Natural and Revealed, to the Conſtitution and courſe of Nature,
Bell's Syſtem of Surgery,
Same work abridged by Waters,
Brigg's Art of Cookery,
Boſton's Human Nature, in its Four Fold State,
Barlow's Works, containing, advice to the Privileged Orders, a Letter to the National Convention of France, &c.
Belliſarius, by M. Marmontel,
Britiſh Album, containing the Poems of, Della Cruſca, Anna Matilda, Arly—Benedict; the Bard, &c. &c.
Baxter's Call to the Unconverted, to Turn and Live, and accept of Mercy, while Mercy may be had, &c.
Brown's Introduction to the Right Underſtanding, of the Oracles of God,
Brothers' (Richard) Prophecies,
Baxter's Saints Everlaſting Reſt; or, a Treatiſe of the Bleſſed State of the Saints in their enjoyment of God in Heaven,
Bogatzky's Golden Treaſury for the Children of God: Conſiſting of Select Texts of the Bible, with Practical Obſervations in Proſe and Verſe, for every day in the year,
Baillie's Morbid Anatomy of ſome of the moſt important parts of the Human Body,
Brief Account of the Aſſociated Preſbyteries,
Boulanger on the Principles and Effects of the Chriſtian Religion,
Booth's Eſſay on the Kingdom of Chriſt,
Bell's Treatiſe on the Management of Ulcers,
Blackſtone's Commentaries on the Laws of England, 4 vols.
Brown's Elements of Medicine, 1 67 and
— Concordance to the Holy Scriptures,

COLUMBIAN ORATOR: containing a Variety of Original Pieces; together with Rules; calculated to improve Youth and others, in the ornamental and uſeful Art of Eloquence; by Caleb Bingham, Author of American Preceptor, &c. This work is the lateſt of the kind, and has already obtained a preference in many Schools and Academies,
Camilla: or, a Picture of Youth, a Novel, by the Author of Evelina, and Cecilia, 3 Vols.
Cook's three Voyages to the Pacific Ocean, to which is prefixed, the Life of Capt. Cook, 2 vols. with Plates,
Same Work, 4 vols. 8vo.
Charlotte, a Tale of Truth, by Mrs. Rowſon,
Curioſities of Literature, conſiſting of Anecdotes, Characters and Obſervations,
Cowper's Poems, and Taſk, 2 vols.
Campbell on Miracles,
Children's Friend, by Berquin, 4 vols.
Either vol. may be had ſeparate, at
Coghlan's (Mrs.) Memoirs, written by herſelf,
Columbian Muſe, a Selection of American Poetry,
Cheſterfield's Principles of Politeneſs,
Calvary, or the Death of Chriſt, a Poem, by R. Cumberland,
Count Roderick's Caſtle, a Tale,
Children's Friend, abridged,
Citizen of the World, or Letters from a Chineſe Philoſopher, reſiding in London, to his friends in the Eaſt,
Campbell's Sacramental Meditations on the Sufferings and Death of Chriſt,
Cooper's Hiſtory of North America,
Cooper's Hiſtory of South America,
— of the Grecian States,
Chapone's Letters on the Improvement of the Mind,
Chriſtian Remembrancer; or ſhort Reflections upon the Faith, Life, and Conduct of a real Chriſtian,
Cullen's Synopſis and Noſology,
— Phyſiology,
Chambaud's Idioms of the French and Engliſh Languages,
Centaur, not Fabulous; in Six Letters to a Friend, on the Life in Vogue,
Carver's Travels through the Interior parts of North America, for more than 5000 miles,
Children's Miſcellany, with Plates,
Conductor Generalis,
Carey's Account of the Fever in Philadelphia,
— Miſcellaneous Trifles, in proſe,
Cheſelden's Anatomy of the Human Body, with 40 Copperplates,
Coxe's View of the United States of America,
Chriſtian's, Scholar's and Farmer's Magazine, 2 vols.
Complete Fortune Teller; being a new and regular Syſtem for foretelling future events, by Aſtrology, Phyſiognomy, Palmiſtry, Moles, Cards, Dreams, &c.
Cecilia: or, Memoirs of an Heireſs, by the Author of Evelina and Camilla, 3 vols.
Cullen's Firſt Lines of the Practice of Phyſic: with practical and explanatory Notes, and the Life and Portrait of the Author, 2 vols.
Cullen's Materia Medica, 2 vols,
Caſtles of Athlin and Dunbayne; a Highland Story, by the Author of Romance of the Foreſt, Myſteries of Udolpho, &c. &c.
Conſtitutions of the ſeveral United States, and of the Federal Government,
Cavern of Death, a Moral Tale,
Cheſelden's Anatomical Tables,
Compendious Syſtem of Mineralogy and Metalgy, extracted from the American Encyclopedia,
DODDRIDGE's Riſe and Progreſs of Religion in the Soul, illuſtrated in a courſe of ſerious and practical Addreſſes, ſuited to perſons of every character and circumſtance,
Same Work,
Ditto.
— Ten Sermons on Regeneration,
Dodſley's Select Fables of Eſop and other Fabuliſts,
Democrat; or, Intrigues and Adventures of Jean le Noir,
Devil on Two Sticks,
Dickinſon's familiar Letters to a Gentleman upon a variety of ſeaſonable and important ſubjects in Religion,
Dickinſon's five Diſcourſes, concerning ſome important points of Chriſtian Faith,
Death of Abel and Cain, from the German of Geſner,
Dana's Selection of Leſſons, in Reading, and Speaking,
De Lolme's Conſtitution of England; in which it is compared with the Republican Form of Government, and the Monarchies in Europe,
Dodd's Thoughts in Priſon, to which are added, Miſcellaneous Pieces,
Divine Maxims and Obſervations,
Dean's New England Farmer, or Georgical Dictionary,
— do. New Edition with large additions,
Dilworth's Art of Bookkeeping,
Davles's Sermons on important Subjects, 3 vols.
Same work, 2 vols.
Dumourier's Memoirs, written by himſelf,
Defence of Uſury, ſhewing the Impolicy of legal reſtraints on the terms of Pecuniary Bargains, by I. Bentham, Eſq.
Dialogues between the Pulpit and Reading Deſk, by Rev. E. Smith,
D'Arcy, a Novel, by Charlotte Smith,
Dodd's Reflections on Death,
Dwight's comprehenſive Syſtem of Geography, by way of Queſtion and Anſwer, for the Uſe of Schools,

Dialogues of Devils,
Dyer's Titles of Chriſt,
ELEMENTS of MORALITY, for the uſe of Children; with an introductory Addreſs
Edwards on Religious Affections, to Parents,
Enfield's Speaker: or, Miſcellaneous Pieces, ſelected from the beſt Engliſh writers,
— Prayers, for the uſe of Families,
— Biographical Sermons: or, a Series of Diſcourſes on the principal characters in Scripture,

— Caſes, argued and ruled at Niſi Prius,
Erſkine's Sermons upon the moſt important and intereſting ſubjects,
— Goſpel Sonnets: or, Spiritual Songs,
Eliot's Medical Pocket Book,
Edwards' Hiſtory of Redemption, with Notes, Hiſtorical, Critical and Theological,

Emma Corbett, a Novel, 2 vols.
Engliſh Hermit, or the unparalleled Sufferings and Surpriſing Adventures of Philip Quarll, an Engliſhman,

Evening Amuſements for the Ladies; or, Original Anecdotes, intended to promote a love of virtue in young minds,
Economy of Human Life,
Edinburgh New Diſpenſatory—new Edition,
Eſtimate of Religion in the faſhionable World, by Hannah More,

Federal Ready Reckoner; or, Trader's Valuable Guide, in purchaſing and ſelling all kinds of Articles, in Dollars and Cents,
Fordyce's Addreſſes to Young Men,
— Sermons to Young Women,
Franklin's (Dr.) Life, written by himſelf,
Frankli ••• (Dr.) Life and Eſſays,
Fiſher's Young Man's beſt Companion,
Fenning's Arithmetic; or, American Youth's Inſtructor,
Flavel's Huſbandry Spiritualized; or, the Heavenly Uſe of Earthly things,
Fair Hibernian, a Novel,
Female Jockey Club; or, a Sketch of the Manners of the Age,
Family Inſtructor, relating to Parents and Children—Maſters and Servants—Huſbands and Wives,
Friend of Youth tranſlated from the French of M ••• erquin, 2 vols.
Flowers of Ancient and Modern Hiſtory, 2 vols.
Fraſer's Young Gentleman and Lady's Aſſiſtant, containing Geography, Natural Hiſtory, Rhetoric, Arithm •••• , and Miſcellany,
Farmer's Friend, or, the Hiſtory of Charles Worthy,

Foreſters, an American Tale; being a Sequel to the Hiſtory of John Bull the Clo • hier, a new Edition, with additions,
Fiſke's twenty-two Sermons on various and important Subjects; chiefly practical,
Freeman's Maſſachuſetts Juſtice; being a Collection of the Laws of the Commonwealth of Maſſachuſetts, relative to the Power and Duty of Juſtices of the Peace, &c.
Fleetwood's Life of Chriſt; together with the Lives and Sufferings of his Holy Apoſtles and Diſciples, 2 vols.
Flavel's Token for Mourners; or, the Advice of Chriſt to a diſtreſſed Mother,
Flavel's Saint indeed, or the great work of a Chriſtian, opened and preſſed,
Fabulous Hiſtories, for the Amuſement of young perſons,
Frugal Houſewife, or Complete Woman Cook,

Ghoſt Seer; or, Apparitioniſt; a Fragment,

div.p: J. WEST HAS ALSO FOR SALE, A Choice Collection OF BOOKS, OF ENGLISH, SCOTCH and IRISH EDITIONS. Alſo, Bibles of all Sizes, Teſtaments, Pſalm Books, Spelling Books, Dictionaries, Singing Books, Account Books, Writing Paper of all ſizes, Quills, Ink Powder, Sealing Wax, Wafers, Pocket Books, Playing Cards, Pen Knives, Children's Books, Ink Stands of all kinds▪ Sand Boxes, and every other article in the Book and Stationary Line, with which Country Merchants and others may be ſupplied, Wholeſale or Retail, on the moſt reaſonable terms. A liberal Allowance to th • ſe who purchaſe largely.
☞ Social Libraries ſupplied on as good Terms as at any other Book Store on the Continent.
